immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description: Current Focus: Immediate engagement with US-based underwater volcano exploration, undersea habitation, submersibles, and underwater robotics (ROVs).  Priority is hands-on learning and participation in active projects. Key Interests: Identifying and joining US universities with strong ocean engineering programs and resources relevant to underwater volcano exploration and undersea habitat design; discovering and participating in relevant US-based meetups and scuba diving events. Goal: Secure hands-on experience in university or industry settings related to these areas by joining active project teams. Current search focus: US universities offering relevant ocean engineering programs; US-based meetups and scuba diving events; research projects and teams actively working on underwater volcano exploration, undersea habitats, ROV/submersible technologies, and submersible operation; opportunities for immediate, hands-on participation in active projects and collaborative groups. Emphasis on readily accessible projects and collaborative learning environments directly related to underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, ROVs, and submersibles. Immediate action items include researching and contacting relevant universities, organizations, and groups focused on these areas, and actively seeking out opportunities to participate in hands-on projects and collaborative teams. This profile prioritizes actively pursuing opportunities for direct, hands-on engagement with underwater volcano exploration, undersea habitat design, ROV/submersible technology, and submersible operation, and related communities. The primary focus is on readily accessible opportunities for immediate involvement in active projects and related university programs and events.
